texts.content_text200: Felix is a 13-year-old boy from Eastern Europe who was discovered during a police raid on an illegal construction site in a Western EU country.
texts.content_text201: Officers initially believed they had encountered undocumented migrant workers, but Felix stood out immediately—he appeared physically exhausted, underweight, and unusually withdrawn for someone his age.
texts.content_text202: Felix spoke very little of the local language. A translator was called, but Felix hesitated even then, offering only fragmented responses. When shown photos of possible relatives found on his phone, he became visibly distressed and refused to continue speaking.
texts.content_text203: Felix’s situation requires coordination between law enforcement, child protection, health services, legal professionals, and NGOs. However, tensions emerge: Police want to question him quickly to identify traffickers; Child protection insists he needs rest before interviews; Prosecutors are concerned about losing evidence; The NGO warns that rushed questioning could retraumatise him...
